msItem.title: Bósa saga
msItem.rubric: Her Hefst Sagan af Herrauði og Bósa
msItem.incipit: Hríngur hefur Konúngur heítid hann réd fyrir Eystra Gautlandi
msItem.explicit: sá Ragnar var sídan kalladur lodbrók og tók hann þad nafn af klædum þeím sem hann lét gőra sér, þá hann vann ormín
msItem.finalRubric: og lúkum ver nú sőgu Herrauds og Bőgu Bósa

msItem.title: Sörla saga sterka
msItem.incipit: J þann tíma sem Hálfdán Kóngur Brőnufostrí stýrdí SvíþԳód hínní kőldu er hann vann af Agnarí hínum audga, en settí Kastó mág sínn yfír England
msItem.explicit: og er eígí getíd þar um hvurt þeím hafdí ordíd barna audíd edur eí,
msItem.finalRubric: líkur her nú sőgunní af Sőrla hínum sterka og hans míkklu afreks verkum, med svo sőgdu nídurlægí og endalýkt

msItem.title: Ásmundar saga víkings
msItem.rubric: Her hefst sagan af Ásmundí Víkíng
msItem.incipit: Hríngur hefur konúngur heítíð hann red fyrir Gaut landi, hann var vitur og vínsæll
msItem.explicit: dóttur áttu þaú er þorbőrg hét, þáu lífdu lengi og intust tíl dauda dags,
msItem.finalRubric: endur hér sőgu Ásmundar víkíngs sonar Eyriks alls

msItem.title: Sigurðar saga þögla
msItem.rubric: Her hefur upp Sőgu af Sígurði þőgula
msItem.incipit: Á Dőgum Artusar kóngs hins fræga er redi fyrir Bretlandi er sída hefur England kallad verid
msItem.explicit: ól vid henni mőrg bőrn og lét heita eptir foreldrum sínum
msItem.finalRubric: og endum vér svo þessa Sőgu,

msItem.title: Þorsteins saga Víkingssonar
msItem.rubric: Sagan af Víkíngí Vífilssyni og þorsteini Víkíngssyni
msItem.incipit: Logi hét maður, sumir kölluðu hann háloga hann nam fyrstur manna Hálogaland
msItem.explicit: var þad sídan kallad Vefreyunautur, þad bar sídan Sturlaugur kóngur starfsami
msItem.finalRubric: og lúkum vér svo sőgu þessarí
msItem.note: 15 chapters. The beginning of the part with Þorsteinn is indicated with a rubric as if it was the start of a new saga, although the chapter count continues normally.

msItem.title: Parmes saga loðinbjarnar
msItem.incipit: Fyrir sunnan Alpesfjöll eru takmörk milli Vallands og Frakklands þar stendur ein Borg sem er köllud Agusta Turena
msItem.finalRubric: og líkur hér ad segja frá Parmes Lodinbirni

msItem.title: Sigurðar saga hreggviðar
msItem.incipit: Á Fyrri tíðum var einn Kóngur sem Hjaldur hét, af ættum kóngs þess er Nor hét
msItem.explicit: lét hann þá ríta hana [...] oddur ófeigsson kom med hana út híngad
msItem.finalRubric: og lúkum vér svo sőgunni af Sigurdi Hreggvið
msItem.note: The title Hér hefur upp sőgu af Sigurdi Hreggvíð seems to have been added later on p. 287 by the scribe.

foliation.p: 1-343, page numbers 76, 77, 88 and 161 omitted, page number 173 used twice

supportDesc.condition: All leaves of the manuscript are on supports. The corners and some of the top margins are frayed, with minor losses of text on pp. 1-4, 114-115, 330-331 and 336-343. On pp. 323-343 there is loss of text due to a blot, and on pp. 3-4 due to a small hole. The ink has faded on pp. 152, 172, 188, 203, 204, 234, 247, 266 and 277, however, the text is still legible.

layout.note: There are no signs for new chapters other than tha the chapter headings are surrounded by dashes. However, on pp. 105-244 (Sigurðar saga þögla, Þorsteins saga Víkingssonar and the first chapters of Parmes saga loðinbjarnar) and 277-343 (the last chapters of Parmes saga loðinbjarnar, and Sigurðar saga snarfara) the chapter headings are in the centre of a line, with blank lines before and after. The right margins of many pages are drawn with pencil, and sometimes with red crayon.

handDesc.handNote: Guðmundur Jónsson á Innraleiti á Skógarströnd

binding.p: The manuscript has a cardboard binding with cloth covers. The quires are not sewn together and are loose in the binding. The binding is in very bad condition, frayed with torn corners and spine. Dimensions: 209x 166x 34. A page printed by Einar Þorð[...] in Reykjavík in 1872 with decorated frames is glued onto the inner side of the cardboard binding, now mostly worn away. On the front it reads: Blunda[...] Bændast[...] GUDLAUGU[...] Ha[...] Prófastsdóttur[...] Ó[...] Ha[...], and on the back: [...], að gætni, [...]eild, röggsemd, [...] þörf, [...] ýði, [...]okar[...] þökk sje drottni, sem þig gaf oss, þín minning æ í blessun vari, Meðan niðar í fljóti foss, Og foldu byggir hölda ska[...] Ó að [...] Og syn[...] Þar s[...] Undir [...]. Underneath this page there is other printed matter pasted down, probably from a newspaper, but only a few words and letters are legible.

history.provenance: According to the waste-sheet, Jón Guðmundsson, father of Guðlaugur Jónsson, á Ölverskrossi í Kolbeinsstaðahreppi owned the manuscript. Guðlaugur Jónsson donated the manuscript on 1st September 1978.

revisionDesc.change: Introduced repository auth file. Updated repository element pointing, adding @ref and removing @key.
Added missing information based on SVH's diss.
